# Stating a prediction

A central task in statistics is *prediction*. Part of the process of making a prediction is to figure out what's what: to assemble your experience, knowledge, judgment, data, etc. to conclude what outcomes are likely. In the end, you need to state your prediction. Statistics makes  use of special tools, displays, and vocabulary to do this. This lesson is about some of the important vocabulary in stating a prediction.
